snippet: Europol, the European police agency, said that it had dismantled a successful cybercrime organization led by Russians who extorted money from computer users.
abstract: European police agency Europol says it has dismantled successful cybercrime organization led by Russians who extorted money from mostly European online users by persuading them to pay spurious police fines for abusive Internet use; network was based in Spain.

byline.contributor: Nicole Perlroth contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Europol, the European police agency, said that it had dismantled a successful cybercrime organization led by Russians who extorted money from computer users.

headline.main: Cybercrime Network Based in Spain Is Broken Up
headline.print_headline: Cybercrime Network Based in Spain Is Broken Up
